Class ec.cosm.costume.Animation

Class ec.cosm.costume.Animation 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.cosm.costume.Animation
public class Animation
extends Object
implements Named, RtCodeable
Class Animation specifies a sequence of named Positions that apply to an Avatar or other in-world object. Animations are grouped and choreographed together by class AnimationProgram.
See Also:
AnimationProgram, Gesture

frameOffsets
The mapping between orientation names and x,y,z offsets, stored as Point3Ds, used by get/setFrameOffsets.
frames
The ordered list of frames that make up the animation.
version

Animation()

addFrame()
Adds a new empty frame (no positions specified) to the list of frames.
classNameToEncode(RtEncoder)
decode(RtDecoder)
encode(RtEncoder)
getAnchorName()
Returns the name of the registration point that frame offsets are relative to.
getFrameCount()
Returns the number of frames.
getFrameOffset(String)
Returns the offset, as a Point3D, between any two consecutive frames in the specified orientation.
getFrames()
Returns the vector of frames.
getName()
Returns the name of this animation.
getPositionNameInFrame(int)
Returns the position name in the specified frame.
insertFrameAt(int)
Adds a new empty frame (no positions specified) at position frameIndex in the list of frames.
removeFrameAt(int)
Removes the frame at position frameIndex in the list of frames
setAnchorName(String)
Sets the name of the registration point that frame offsets are relative to.
setFrameOffset(float, float, float, String)
Specifies the offset between any two consecutive frames in the specified orientation.
setName(String)
Sets the name of this animation.
setPositionNameInFrame(int, String)
Sets the position name of the specified frame.

version 
  public static String version
frames 
  public Vector frames
The ordered list of frames that make up the animation. It can be an empty list, or null, for a degenerate do-nothing animation.
frameOffsets 
  public Hashtable frameOffsets
The mapping between orientation names and x,y,z offsets, stored as Point3Ds, used by get/setFrameOffsets. Don't use this directly -- use get/setFrameOffsets instead.

Animation 
  public Animation()

getName 
  public String getName()
Returns the name of this animation. It is displayed while editing the animation and possibly in-world when choosing a animation to perform.
See Also:
setName
setName 
  public void setName(String newName)
Sets the name of this animation.

getName

  public String getAnchorName()
Returns the name of the registration point that frame offsets are relative to.
See Also:
getFrameOffset
setAnchorName 
  public void setAnchorName(String newName)
Sets the name of the registration point that frame offsets are relative to.
See Also:
getAnchorName
getFrameOffset 
  public Point3D getFrameOffset(String orientationName)
Returns the offset, as a Point3D, between any two consecutive frames in the specified orientation.
setFrameOffset 
  public void setFrameOffset(float deltaX,
                             float deltaY,
                             float deltaZ,
                             String orientationName)
Specifies the offset between any two consecutive frames in the specified orientation.
See Also:
getFrameOffset
getFrameCount 
  public int getFrameCount()
Returns the number of frames.
addFrame 
  public AnimationFrame addFrame()
Adds a new empty frame (no positions specified) to the list of frames. Returns the new frame.
insertFrameAt 
  public AnimationFrame insertFrameAt(int frameIndex)
Adds a new empty frame (no positions specified) at position frameIndex in the list of frames. Returns the new frame.
removeFrameAt 
  public void removeFrameAt(int frameIndex)
Removes the frame at position frameIndex in the list of frames
getPositionNameInFrame 
  public String getPositionNameInFrame(int frameIndex)
Returns the position name in the specified frame.
setPositionNameInFrame 
  public void setPositionNameInFrame(int frameIndex,
                                     String positionName)
Sets the position name of the specified frame. The frameIndex must correspond to an already-created frame.
See Also:
addFrame
getFrames 
  public Vector getFrames()
Returns the vector of frames. Returns null if the vector has not yet been created.
